documents.document: I ‘love it’ when I think I’m highly individual, then something like this shows me I’m actually just 1 in 4. FYI I’m the parachutist. #leadership #FemaleEntrepreneur https://t.co/3xKfSqsxxr

@paulbatterham OMG he won’t back down either. It’s comparable to managing the washing / cooking / food shopping apparently. I feel like I’m going mad 😂
Just slightly lost it at husband over share of duties - his response to things he does I don’t recognise: Managing the heating. Point made? 😂#bluejobs #feminism #ffs

Great to get a call from a journalist this morning about the horrible sexist kids water bottles I got from Ocado. She found the story using #everydaysexism great to feel the 💪 of social media. Keep calling this sexist sh!t out. #EqualityForAll #sexism https://t.co/PREOVGaPEV

Fortunately it’s a rare day I commute at peak...but to the guy who just stomped REALLY hard on my foot, profusely apologised as I tried not to cry/swear. But then rapidly took the only seat when someone moved. Actions speak louder than words dude 😡 #flexibleworking #remotework
@quinn_eleanor @Ocado Thank you. It does deserve a WTF. Absolutely hideous.

@naysayer11 Interesting I wonder whether recent Supreme Court Judgement on end of life care will impact on this?
#digitalhealth #ThoughtLeader https://t.co/CBotoAcqD8

@coldethyl2 @traddyh @drkathrynmannix I remember this - I couldn’t sleep for what felt like years when I found out we died. No one would talk about it to me. It’s quite a buzzard facet of British culture
How have we got to this? I got asked the same question at one year injections - but not one thing about me. Only one thing is 💯 proven: Unhappy mum = unhappy baby. https://t.co/yvnDuJM8mT
My favourite position too 👍🏻 https://t.co/2eFpk9k9DV

Two incongruous but #heatwave related incidents today:
1. I’ve just a steaming pile of poo in the garden for husband to ‘sort’ as 3 yo as taken to toileting alfresco.
2. I just got called ‘cutie pie’ by a 55+ yo in a convertible Smart car.
#heatwaveproblems #heatwaveuk

@hadleybeeman @MattHancock Wrong lesson: make it the norm that pretty much every tech solution has to knock down every CCG / trust door 🚪

@KateBurkeNHS Pretty sure you’d love to pay it forwards to your own kids someday. I always feel really tight asking my mum to help as she works harder than any person I know! But needs must sometimes. Good luck 💪it’s the weekend soon!
I got so much out of this course - if you’re a small business, already growing well and looking to double down on that growth sign up #SME #smesupport https://t.co/uTa9NiJoDF
Call for papers..#healthtech #techforgood w https://t.co/Jo6QtjgNgJ

RT @JournalistaLtd: Look who we bumped into! Great to see famous #instastar @doctors_kitchen at #Expo18NHS.
Really interesting to hear his…

This is a brilliant piece: “Make your own active choices every damned day about whether what you are doing – and how you are doing it – are right for you.” Thank you 🙏🏻 @CArmstrongLDN https://t.co/mf0CiOh8t4
Great news for our clients @medCrowd and @IOCOM12 from the health minister today as ‘interoperability’ is word of the day at #NHSExpo18 https://t.co/eayfaVNntn

Only thing better than being ace yourself is watching your colleagues being bloody awesome 👏🏻 go @msclews you are an interviewing tour de force! #journo #PublicRelations #Entrepreneurship https://t.co/MC7zfws4we

I love seeing ministers coming back to journalist’s questions immediately on social. That’s engagement. Organisations still using it as a broadcast tool - take note. #socialmedia #nhscomms #nhsengland #DHcomms well done 👍🏻 @MattHancock and team. https://t.co/Gx6zZgUTYW
@CArmstrongLDN @KateBurkeNHS We get handed down defaults of how family and work need to be divided from such a young age. Starting at the point a woman becomes a mother is far too late.

@KateBurkeNHS @CArmstrongLDN It’s just starting to be talked about I feel. @cloverstroud talked so openly about the dark violent thoughts that can casually stalk around your mind with your tiny baby at hand. I cried with a self-recognition. More of this pls!

@CArmstrongLDN @KateBurkeNHS The ridiculous thing was I did it to myself. I run my own business. But I feared I’d lose all my clients and team if I didn’t just pretend like having a baby hadn’t happened and get back ‘to it’. The biggest battle we have to win is in women’s own heads.

@KateBurkeNHS @CArmstrongLDN This is such an important topic - the Chinese walls we create between personal and professional contribute enormously to #PND in working women. When I went back to work 4 months post-partum,exclusively breastfeeding (in cupboards) I felt I had to hide any impact of that entirely.

There are client kick off meetings - and there are client KICK OFF meetings. I’ll leave you to guess which one this was. Needless to say we’re pretty stoked to be working with @Voa1234 and the rest of the @IOCOM12 team. #healthcarePR #techforgood #HealthTech https://t.co/J9b6SuN6PS
Bon Jovi, Premier League football clubs and hamster kidneys. Not your usual #NHSExpo18 keynote.
Yes - just in a uni pop, coming out shortly. Are you about? https://t.co/22X9MwULvL

Wondering what are the key ingredients to a story that makes it past the fortress of NHS focussed health tech news desks? Read our four pointers here: #digitalhealth #techforgood #nhscomms #healthpr #healthtech https://t.co/BzL66Txyvo
@keithgrimes Nice to see your smiling VR covered face from a video as we walked through the entrance!

Great to be at #NHSExpo2018 with three of our healthcare team this year working for @HealthcareUK Predictions for high-street brands coming into this space are now reality as Amazon dominate the arena entrance with a massive Alexa #healthtech #techforgood https://t.co/3gWvZdVW8r
@DrAndyCarr @keithgrimes @curingtheworld Really interesting - in your opinion, where did we get to in 2.0? Many people are still aiming for there.

@keithgrimes @curingtheworld Wow - I didn’t realise it was an actual ‘thing’. I feel that outward displays of faith in the NHS is so out of place. But then we pay for hospital chaplains! So maybe I’m out of touch.
@keithgrimes @curingtheworld It’s not just one GP either. I’d move if I didn’t have 137 things on my to do list before then.

@curingtheworld @keithgrimes Take out religious posters from consulting rooms. And please don’t add ‘god pray for you’ when I jump off the consulting table. It’s rather disconcerting. I was hoping for treatment rather than prayers!
@Dysology Wow that’s one helluva image!
Cracking panel of journalists, health tech start up and investor to launch the first of our four comms workshops with @DHealthLDN thank you to @WayraUK for hosting us. https://t.co/Vdpp06eCWT
@ClareSpeak This is absolutely hilarious. I think that is actually a picture of her on her own bed cover. It must be a parody!
#mediatraining #PR #nhscomms https://t.co/7VSNZzno0p

Super insight into a top journalist that poses a reason why female reporters are leading the way on reporting on emerging online trends: “I think you need to be extremely good at picking up on subtleties and subtext in communication” #Tech4Good #MediaMatters #techpr https://t.co/RcjnFuXtir
@ShaunLintern @sathNHS And that’s why journos make awesome PRs 👍🏻the dark side is waiting for you @ShaunLintern

So that’s a fun and very apt way to commute back to ‘holiday’ in Suffolk after a day’s ‘work break’ from the kids with my favourite futurist @keithgrimes Funny how things go 🙃holiday vs. work when two toddlers are involved! #teslatestdrive #TheFutureIsNow https://t.co/80fKBQzWET

Nailing #worklifeblend early. Not for this one a world where you have to hide the personal to meet a patriarchal definition of ‘professional’. Check out my chat on #defythedefaults @girltribegang #peckham https://t.co/ZvJZjeTB3b https://t.co/lB2PBmkOMf
I’m on holiday and that goat story even too much for me. You’re kidding yourself if you think that’s news. Pun intended. #goats #sillyseason #bbcnews #pr #news

I’m loving these #lists. Such wisdom in them. But as I listen to my little 9yo sister bemoan her problem friends I think heeding this list at an early age could have one of the biggest lifetime impacts. We only have so much time. Proximity = influence. #Wisdomwednesday https://t.co/QkuGi6hOSt

Wow. Congratulations. Certainly at times the sand in the oyster of the NHS. But I strongly believe that together they have the power to make primary care pearly again!#healthtech #Techforsociety #babylon #primarycare #nhs https://t.co/LDtfMaNdvz

@ianmakgill @paulbatterham The only solution I could conjur up was a 1970s ‘good wallop’ it really would have made me feel better for about 0.7 seconds. So I resisted, gave him a cuddle instead, gritted my teeth and just got out of there pronto.

@ianmakgill @paulbatterham You’ve nailed it. Today it was me. My daughter hadn’t stopped wiggling for 7 hours, my son laying on the floor in a beautiful pub in Walberswick insisting a freezing cold bowl of pasta was ‘too hot’. I paid for that experience. Give me excrement any day of the week over that.
The more I think about this topic the more cornerstone it feels to everything that needs to be done and feels good! #disputethedefault https://t.co/nEEOdUQSEZ
Sail boats ✅ wicker basket ✅ Liberty S’well ✅ Cider ✅ middle class goals complete 😅#holidaywanker #suffolkisquiteposh #imdefinitelynotposh https://t.co/W06Kvj45Fs

Need to keep @dollyalderton recent piece in @TheSTStyle magazine in mind this week whilst holidaying in Aldeburgh...although I’m pretty damn sure I would do the crab thing. I eat it once a week in Brockley! #foodie #Suffolk https://t.co/mk6ssdx2P7
@paulbatterham No one in their right mind would have kids unless they physically ached for them. Damn that ache. #shouldhavetriedpainkillers
@poornabell Yoga at Brockwell lido on Monday with Tania Brown. You can cool down with a dip afterwards and reward yourself with something delicious at their gorgeous cafe. https://t.co/MaHD91mZpd
Wow 😲 awesome pic! https://t.co/ebZ5bYc2dg

Powerful anarchic campaigning here on the Northern Line by #EducationNotExclusion . Hard numbers hit it home: 35 children are permanently excluded from school every DAY. Just 1% of these kids will ever go on to get 5 decent GCSEs they need. #campaign https://t.co/TjZjh6EZZc

@SalasAsia It’s so sad the women that get dragged down with these men. When I exposed a struck off GP working back in the NHS after he’d served time for sexual abuse his wife wrote me a scathing letter saying I’d ruined her family’s life. Hmmm. I think was your husband love.
@naysayer11 Problem is the right would love it. It’d divide the left vote. We need to transform from within. It’s just so freaking painful to be a part of right now 🤦🏻‍♀️
@keithgrimes No no no no. I don’t think it would work. I’d grind my teeth to the gum. And my brain might 🤯

Ain't that the truth:"When the boss doesn’t feel rested, the whole unit pays a price," says @HarvardBiz in an article this month on impact of sleep in business referencing our client @Sleepio it took me a year to unravel some of decisions I made post-partum! #FemaleEntrepreneur
Someone is eating opposite me and I’m dying inside. Can you get therapy for this? Actually, if it involves listening to problem masticating. I’ll just get used to moving. #misophoniaisreal
@MaryjaneFurniss @ClareTickell After a bad breakup I realised I was out wearing two different pairs of black heals, of very different heights.
